intro: Cynoglossum henricksonii, commonly known as Henrickson's forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive blue to violet flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It is a perennial herb that thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its flowers bloom in early summer and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
